page.title: 04Housing Additions to Area
page.content: Until about 20 years ago The Northway was a piece of open farmland. The land is quite steeply sloping and had not been used for building except for one farm. Today it has changed. The land which is between Wolverhampton and Dudley at the edge of the West Widlands has been built on. There are now many detached and semi detached houses. They have been built on all but the steepest ground which is now the back gardens of the most expensive homes. At the very top of the slope there is a small wood which makes the area look like the countryside. From the new estate the view is very good. You can see many kilometres into nearby Staffordshire and Shropshire. You can see many fields and trees. You would not think you are just round the corner from the polluted West Midlands.
